server.connection
Interface Communicable

All Known Implementing Classes:
MessageConnection, TextConnection
public interface Communicable

Provides a common interface for connecting and communicating with a client. This neatly abstracts certain concepts that are useful in the Template design pattern found in ServerThread.

Method Summary
 ServerMessage getMessage()
          This blocks until a message is sent from the client, at which put the method returns.
 void openConnection(java.net.Socket socket)
          Opens a connection to a client.
 void sendMessage(ClientMessage message)
          Sends a message to a client.
 void terminate()
          Closes the connection to the client.
 

Method Detail

openConnection

void openConnection(java.net.Socket socket)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Opens a connection to a client. A read/write connection can be established using the provided socket.

Parameters:
socket - client connection as a socket
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getMessage

ServerMessage getMessage()
This blocks until a message is sent from the client, at which put the method returns. This is useful in a loop to constantly get input from the client.

Returns:
message sent from the client

sendMessage

void sendMessage(ClientMessage message)
Sends a message to a client.

Parameters:
message - the message that is sent to the client

terminate

void terminate()
Closes the connection to the client.
